ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Critical thinking regarding how science and the law overlap, and how they sometimes work together and other times are in conflict/contradiction
I learned about the many areas where law and psychology intersect, and how psychology helps inform the law.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Generally, the course was awesome and I learned a lot from it.

Having students talk about their response papers during class inevitably devolved into each student giving a long monologue summary of their response paper one by one, with little discussion regarding the ideas proposed by the students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Absolutely. Actually, I think this course is useful for almost anyone.
Yes! I think this course is important for law and non-law students alike. I highly recommend it, as it gives valuable insights to our justice system of which we are all a part.
